main event: An observer reported sighting a brilliantly illuminated elliptical or cigar-shaped object flying at a high speed over Fort Lauderdale, Florida on April 4, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed flying straight and level at an estimated altitude of 15,000 to 20,000 feet., The observer stated it was moving faster than he had seen before., The object was sighted at approximately 35Â° above the horizon from a distance of 15 to 20 miles., The sighting lasted about 15 seconds before the object flew out of sight., The observer was a former military pilot, indicating his familiarity with aircraft speeds.
sighted object: brilliantly illuminated elliptical or cigar-shaped object
witness description: The main observer was a former pilot with considerable knowledge of jet type aircraft.
